page.title: 10SERVICES TO THE HOME
page.content: As we live in a sparsely populated area of farm, forest & moorland, services are scant. There are very few metalled roads & no bus services. We have no shops & so a car is needed. The milkman calls 3 days a week. There is one post box & a Landrover is used by the postman in winter. Deliveries are to locked mailboxes at the roadside if the track is long. There are no travelling shops, but the mobile library calls fortnightly. The overhead electricity lines are checked annually by a man walking the line in good weather. Cooking, heating & lighting are fuelled by electricity, oil or solid fuel. There is no gas supply. All the farms use spring water, although piped water is also available. There is no mains sewerage. The dustmen come to the end of the farm tracks and bins are left there.
